definition: startup (company, phase etc)/newly established/in the early stages
to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create

sentences.english: In the US, there are barely half as many established companies as there are start-up businesses.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，僅有一半的知名企業爲初創企業。
我看到過初創公司這樣做。

sentences.english: Buddhism is the religion founded by Buddha in North India.
sentences.chinese: 梵學是佛陀初創於印度南部之宗學。

sentences.english: Nowadays a lot of startups don't want to raise multi-million dollar series A rounds.
sentences.chinese: 很多初創企業不願進行動輒上百萬的首輪資金籌集。

sentences.english: You must work hard to remain visible and active among your ever-budding network of friends and contacts.
sentences.chinese: 你必須在初創的朋友和關係網絡中保持可見和活躍。

sentences.english: Apple keeps winning because it's a giant startup.
sentences.chinese: 蘋果保持勝績的原因是它是一個巨大的“初創公司”。

sentences.english: Musical. ly is a very small startup based in Shanghai with only 10 people.
sentences.chinese: ly是一家位於上海的非常非常小的初創公司。

sentences.english: At the top end is the business logic created by startups and established technology companies.
sentences.chinese: 最上層是初創公司和現有的技術公司創造的商業邏輯。

sentences.english: Start-up in the Song Dynasty, Ming Dynasty Hongzhi Xifeng built on top of years of shift.
sentences.chinese: 初創於宋代，明代弘治年間移建西峯頂上。

sentences.english: This is one of the things startups fix.
sentences.chinese: 這是初創公司需要解決的問題之一。

sentences.english: Chinese start-up animation is performed by well-known the Wan brothers to the finish.
sentences.chinese: 中國動畫的初創工作，是由著名的萬氏兄弟來完成的。

sentences.english: Seventeen- year is gold issue and the newly established issue of minority subject film.
sentences.chinese: 十七年是少數民族題材電影的初創期和黃金期。

sentences.english: Early in my career, an associate embezzled a large sum of money.
sentences.chinese: 在我的事業初創時期，一夥合夥人侵吞了一大筆錢。

sentences.english: There do not seem to be that many ready this time.
sentences.chinese: 而現在對初創公司來說，做好準備的國家似乎並不多。

sentences.english: This mood even extends to internet start-ups.
sentences.chinese: 這種情緒已經擴展到了互聯網公司的初創期。

sentences.english: The ASJA is still in its infancy.

definition: to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself
creative industries (design, music, publishing etc)/abbr. for 文化創意產業|文化创意产业
to begin an undertaking/to start a major task/to initiate/to venture/venture/entrepreneurship
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
to enter and garrison/(fig.) to establish a presence in
every trade/all professions/all walks of life
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
